essay.prompt: Discuss the key challenges in 2D model fitting as illustrated in the lecture. Categorize the problems into noise, extraneous data (clutter/outliers), and missing data (occlusions). For each category, provide a real-world example from the slides, explain why it violates ideal assumptions, and suggest a computational strategy (e.g., RANSAC, part-based models, robust estimators) to address it. Conclude with a discussion on how increasing model complexity (from lines to articulated cars) impacts both robustness and computational cost.

criteria.description: Clearly defines model fitting as estimating parameters of a geometric model from image features.
Mentions use of mathematical models with parameters (size, position, orientation).
Lists at least two primitives (e.g., line, circle, ellipse).
Defines as small random errors in feature locations; links to robust estimators.
Defines as irrelevant features; example: multiple coins when fitting one circle.
Synonym for extraneous data; used in context of background distractors.
Refers to data not belonging to the target model instance.
Defines as parts of the object not visible; example: occluded car wheel.
Specific cause of missing data in real scenes.
Uses house facade example to illustrate multiple lines and occlusion.
Uses coin example to show clutter/outliers.
Discusses complexity of articulated, multi-part model.
Explains hypothesis-and-verify paradigm for handling outliers.
Mentions M-estimators or least median of squares as alternatives.
Suggests modeling car as assembly of ellipses to handle occlusion.
Briefly notes minimal subsets for parameter estimation.
Mentions consensus set size or residual error.
Discusses trade-off: more complex models need more hypotheses.
Acknowledges deformable or pose-varying components in complex models.

rubric.grading_notes: Require at least one example per challenge category. Full credit for suggesting appropriate algorithm (e.g., RANSAC for outliers). Deduct if strategies are generic or not linked to specific problem. Partial credit for good intuition without naming algorithms.

notes_for_integration.formatting: JSON-only output intended for automated ingestion.
